intro: Guarea rubrisepala, commonly known as the red-sepaled guarea, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other valuable hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its distinctive red calyces that persist on the fruit even after maturity. Its leaves are typically alternate and pinnately compound, with a rough texture. The tree produces small, fragrant flowers that are yellowish-green with prominent red sepals, contributing to its ornamental value.
